ai-mn102:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn102:2.1_0: “Mendicants, there are some ascetics and brahmins who theorize about the future, and assert various hypotheses concerning the future.
ai-mn102:2.2_0: Some propose this: ‘The self is percipient and is sound after death.’
ai-mn102:2.4_0: Some propose this: ‘The self is non-percipient and is sound after death.’
ai-mn102:2.6_0: Some propose this: ‘The self neither percipient nor non-percipient after death.’
ai-mn102:2.8_0: But some assert the annihilation, eradication, and obliteration of an existing being, while others propose extinguishment in the present life.
ai-mn102:2.9_0: Thus they assert an existent self that is sound after death; or they assert the annihilation of an existing being; or they propose extinguishment in the present life.
ai-mn102:2.10_0: In this way five become three, and three become five.
ai-mn102:2.11_0: This is the passage for recitation of the five and three.
ai-mn102:3.1_0: Now, the ascetics and brahmins who assert a self that is percipient and sound after death describe it as having form, or being formless, or both having form and being formless, or neither having form nor being formless. Or they describe it as of unified perception, or of diverse perception, or of limited perception, or of limitless perception.
ai-mn102:4.1_0: The Realized One understands this as follows.
ai-mn102:4.2_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who assert a self that is percipient and sound after death, describing it as having form, or being formless, or both having form and being formless, or neither having form nor being formless. Or they describe it as of unified perception, or of diverse perception, or of limited perception, or of limitless perception.
ai-mn102:4.3_0: If it is physical, non-percipient, and she perceives the perception of form.
ai-mn102:4.4_0: ‘There is no such thing in the dimension of nothingness.’
ai-mn102:4.5_0: ‘The aggregate of choices is the extent necessary.’
ai-mn102:4.6_0: Understanding thus and seeing the escape from it, the Realized One has gone beyond all that.
ai-mn102:5.1_0: Now, the ascetics and brahmins who assert a self that is non-percipient and sound after death describe it as having form, or being formless, or both having form and being formless, or neither having form nor being formless.
ai-mn102:6.1_0: So they reject those who assert a self that is percipient and sound after death.
ai-mn102:6.3_0: Because they believe that perception is a disease, a boil, a dart, and that the state of non-perception is peaceful and sublime.
ai-mn102:7.1_0: The Realized One understands this as follows.
ai-mn102:7.2_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who assert a self that is non-percipient and sound after death, describing it as having form, or being formless, or both having form and being formless, or neither having form nor being formless.
ai-mn102:7.3_0: But if any ascetic or brahmin should say this:
ai-mn102:7.4_0: ‘Apart from form, feeling, perception, and choices, I will describe the coming and going of consciousness, its passing away and reappearing, its growth, increase, and maturity.’
ai-mn102:7.6_0: ‘The aggregate of choices is the extent necessary.’
ai-mn102:7.7_0: Understanding thus and seeing the escape from it, the Realized One has gone beyond all that.
ai-mn102:8.1_0: Now, the ascetics and brahmins who assert a self that is neither percipient nor non-percipient and sound after death describe it as having form, or being formless, or both having form and being formless, or neither having form nor being formless.
ai-mn102:9.1_0: So they reject those who assert a self that is percipient and sound after death, as well as those who assert a self that is non-percipient and sound after death.
ai-mn102:9.3_0: Because they believe that perception is a disease, a boil, a dart, and that the state of neither perception nor non-perception is peaceful and sublime.
ai-mn102:9.4_0: ‘The perception of neither perception nor non-perception.’
ai-mn102:10.1_0: The Realized One understands this as follows.
ai-mn102:10.2_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who assert a self that is neither percipient nor non-percipient and sound after death, describing it as having form, or being formless, or both having form and being formless, or neither having form nor being formless.
ai-mn102:10.3_0: Some ascetics or brahmins assert the embracing of that dimension merely through the conditioned phenomena of what is seen, heard, thought, and known. But that is said to be a disastrous approach.
ai-mn102:10.4_0: For that dimension is said to be not attainable by means of conditioned phenomena,
ai-mn102:10.5_0: but only with a residue of conditioned phenomena.
ai-mn102:10.6_0: ‘The aggregate of choices is the extent necessary.’
ai-mn102:10.7_0: Understanding thus and seeing the escape from it, the Realized One has gone beyond all that.
ai-mn102:11.1_0: Now, the ascetics and brahmins who assert the annihilation, eradication, and obliteration of an existing being reject those who assert a self that is sound after death, whether percipient or non-percipient or neither percipient non-percipient.
ai-mn102:11.3_0: Because all of those ascetics and brahmins only assert their attachment to moving up to a higher realm:
ai-mn102:12.1_0: Suppose a trader was going to market, thinking:
ai-mn102:12.2_0: ‘This is mine, I am this, it will not be mine.’
ai-mn102:12.3_0: In the same way, those ascetics and brahmins seem to be like traders when they say:
ai-mn102:12.5_0: The Realized One understands this as follows.
ai-mn102:12.6_0: The ascetics and brahmins who assert the annihilation, eradication, and obliteration of an existing being; from fear and disgust with identity, they just keep running and circling around identity.
ai-mn102:12.7_0: Suppose a dog on a leash was tethered to a strong post or pillar. It would just keeping running and circling around that post or pillar.
ai-mn102:12.8_0: In the same way, those ascetics and brahmins, from fear and disgust with identity, just keep running and circling around identity.
ai-mn102:12.9_0: ‘The aggregate of choices is the extent necessary.’
ai-mn102:12.10_0: Understanding thus and seeing the escape from it, the Realized One has gone beyond all that.
ai-mn102:13.1_0: Whatever ascetics and brahmins theorize about the future, and propose various hypotheses concerning the future, all of them propose one or other of these five theses.
ai-mn102:14.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who theorize about the past, and propose various hypotheses concerning the past. They propose the following, each insisting that theirs is the only truth and that everything else is wrong.
ai-mn102:14.2_0: ‘The self and the cosmos are eternal.’
ai-mn102:14.3_0: ‘The self and the cosmos are not eternal.’
ai-mn102:14.4_0: ‘The self and the cosmos are both eternal and not eternal.’
ai-mn102:14.5_0: ‘The self and the cosmos are neither eternal nor not eternal.’
ai-mn102:14.6_0: ‘The self and the cosmos are finite.’
ai-mn102:14.7_0: ‘The self and the cosmos are infinite.’
ai-mn102:14.8_0: ‘The self and the cosmos are both finite and infinite.’
ai-mn102:14.9_0: ‘The self and the cosmos are neither finite nor infinite.’
ai-mn102:14.10_0: ‘The self and the cosmos are unified in perception.’
ai-mn102:14.11_0: ‘The self and the cosmos are diverse in perception.’
ai-mn102:14.12_0: ‘The self and the cosmos have limited perception.’
ai-mn102:14.13_0: ‘The self and the cosmos have limitless perception.’
ai-mn102:14.14_0: ‘The self and the cosmos experience nothing but happiness.’
ai-mn102:14.15_0: ‘The self and the cosmos experience nothing but suffering.’
ai-mn102:14.16_0: ‘The self and the cosmos experience both happiness and suffering.’
ai-mn102:14.17_0: ‘The self and the cosmos experience neither happiness nor suffering.’
ai-mn102:14.18_0: Now that is what they do.
ai-mn102:15.1_0: The view of those ascetics and brahmins who say that
ai-mn102:15.2_0: ‘The self and the cosmos are eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.’ It’s simply not possible for them to have purified and clear personal knowledge of this, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration.
ai-mn102:15.3_0: But this extent there are no knowledge and vision, so are they considered to be wise. When they don’t know whether the cosmos is eternal, they apply it to continued existence.
ai-mn102:15.4_0: ‘The aggregate of choices is the extent necessary.’
ai-mn102:15.5_0: Understanding thus and seeing the escape from it, the Realized One has gone beyond all that.
ai-mn102:16.1_0: The view of those ascetics and brahmins who say that
ai-mn102:16.2_0: The self and the cosmos are not eternal,
ai-mn102:16.4_0: or neither eternal nor not eternal.
ai-mn102:16.15_0: or experience both happiness and suffering,
ai-mn102:16.16_0: or experience neither happiness nor suffering. It’s simply not possible for them to have purified and clear personal knowledge of this, apart from faith, preference, oral tradition, reasoned contemplation, or acceptance of a view after consideration.
ai-mn102:16.17_0: But this extent there are no knowledge and vision, so are they considered to be wise. When they don’t know whether the cosmos is eternal, they apply it to continued existence.
ai-mn102:16.18_0: ‘The aggregate of choices is the extent necessary.’
ai-mn102:16.19_0: Understanding thus and seeing the escape from it, the Realized One has gone beyond all that.
ai-mn102:17.1_0: Now, some ascetics and brahmins, letting go of theories about the past and the future, shedding the fetters of sensuality, enter and remain in the rapture of seclusion:
ai-mn102:17.2_0: ‘This is peaceful, this is sublime, that is, I enter and remain in the rapture of seclusion.’
ai-mn102:17.3_0: The rapture of seclusion that rapture ceases.
ai-mn102:17.4_0: When the rapture of seclusion ceases, sadness arises; and when sadness ceases, the rapture of seclusion arises.
ai-mn102:18.1_0: It’s like how the sunlight fills the space when the shadow leaves, or the shadow fills the space when the sunshine leaves.
ai-mn102:18.2_0: In the same way, when the rapture of seclusion ceases, sadness arises; and when sadness ceases, the rapture of seclusion arises.
ai-mn102:18.3_0: The Realized One understands this as follows.
ai-mn102:18.4_0: This good ascetic or brahmin, letting go of theories about the past and the future, shedding the fetters of sensuality, enters and remains in the rapture of seclusion:
ai-mn102:18.5_0: ‘This is peaceful, this is sublime, that is, I enter and remain in the rapture of seclusion.’
ai-mn102:18.6_0: The rapture of seclusion that rapture ceases.
ai-mn102:18.7_0: When the rapture of seclusion ceases, sadness arises; and when sadness ceases, the rapture of seclusion arises.
ai-mn102:18.8_0: ‘The aggregate of choices is the extent necessary.’
ai-mn102:18.9_0: Understanding thus and seeing the escape from it, the Realized One has gone beyond all that.
ai-mn102:19.1_0: Now, some ascetics and brahmins, letting go of theories about the past and the future, shedding the fetters of sensuality, going beyond the rapture of seclusion, enter and remain in spiritual bliss.
ai-mn102:19.2_0: ‘This is peaceful, this is sublime—the happiness.’
ai-mn102:19.4_0: The rapture of seclusion, spiritual bliss, and the rapture of seclusion arises.
ai-mn102:20.1_0: It’s like how the sunlight fills the space when the shadow leaves, or the shadow fills the space when the sunshine leaves.
ai-mn102:20.2_0: In the same way, when the rapture of seclusion ceases, a spiritual bliss arises; and rapture arises.
ai-mn102:20.3_0: The Realized One understands this as follows.
ai-mn102:20.4_0: This good ascetic or brahmin, letting go of theories about the past and the future, shedding the fetters of sensuality, going beyond the rapture of seclusion, enters and remains in spiritual bliss.
ai-mn102:20.5_0: ‘This is peaceful, this is sublime—the happiness.’
ai-mn102:20.7_0: The rapture of seclusion, spiritual bliss, and the rapture of seclusion arises.
ai-mn102:20.8_0: ‘The aggregate of choices is the extent necessary.’
ai-mn102:20.9_0: Understanding thus and seeing the escape from it, the Realized One has gone beyond all that.
ai-mn102:21.1_0: Now, some ascetics and brahmins, letting go of theories about the past and the future, shedding the fetters of sensuality, going beyond the rapture of seclusion and spiritual bliss, enter and remain in neutral feeling.
ai-mn102:21.2_0: ‘This is peaceful, this is sublime, and a neutral feeling.’
ai-mn102:21.4_0: Neutral feeling arises; and neutral feeling arises.
ai-mn102:22.1_0: It’s like how the sunlight fills the space when the shadow leaves, or the shadow fills the space when the sunshine leaves.
ai-mn102:22.2_0: In the same way, pleasant, painful, and neutral feelings arise.
ai-mn102:22.3_0: The Realized One understands this as follows.
ai-mn102:22.4_0: This good ascetic or brahmin, letting go of theories about the past and the future, shedding the fetters of sensuality, going beyond the rapture of seclusion and spiritual bliss, enters and remains in neutral feeling.
ai-mn102:22.5_0: ‘This is peaceful, this is sublime, and a neutral feeling.’
ai-mn102:22.7_0: Neutral feeling arises; and neutral feeling arises.
ai-mn102:22.8_0: ‘The aggregate of choices is the extent necessary.’
ai-mn102:22.9_0: Understanding thus and seeing the escape from it, the Realized One has gone beyond all that.
ai-mn102:23.1_0: Now, some ascetics and brahmins, letting go of theories about the past and the future, shedding the fetters of sensuality, go beyond the rapture of seclusion, spiritual bliss, and neutral feeling.
ai-mn102:23.2_0: They regard themselves like this: ‘I am at peace; I am extinguished; I am free of grasping.’
ai-mn102:24.1_0: The Realized One understands this as follows.
ai-mn102:24.2_0: This good ascetic or brahmin, letting go of theories about the past and the future, shedding the fetters of sensuality, goes beyond the rapture of seclusion, spiritual bliss, and neutral feeling.
ai-mn102:24.3_0: They regard themselves like this: ‘I am at peace; I am extinguished; I am free of grasping.’
ai-mn102:24.4_0: Clearly this venerable speaks of a practice that’s conducive to extinguishment.
ai-mn102:24.5_0: Nevertheless, they still grasp at theories about the past or the future, or the fetters of sensuality, or the rapture of seclusion, or spiritual bliss, or neutral feeling.
ai-mn102:24.6_0: And when they regard themselves like this:
ai-mn102:24.7_0: ‘I am at peace; I am extinguished; I am free of grasping,’ that’s also said to be grasping on their part.
ai-mn102:24.8_0: ‘The aggregate of choices is the extent necessary.’
ai-mn102:24.9_0: Understanding thus and seeing the escape from it, the Realized One has gone beyond all that.
ai-mn102:25.1_0: But the Realized One has awakened to the supreme state of sublime peace, that is,
ai-mn102:25.2_0: liberation by not grasping after truly understanding these six sense fields’ origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape.”
ai-mn102:25.3_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn102:25.4_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn102:25.5_0: The second group of five on “with” is finished.
